# claude-autopilot
> Autonomous task runner for Claude Code. Queues coding tasks, detects rate limits, waits for reset, and auto-resumes so Claude keeps working while you sleep.

## What it does
- Wraps Claude Code CLI as a subprocess
- Monitors output for rate-limit signals (exit codes, stderr/stdout patterns)
- Parses reset timestamps (timezone-aware, 12hr/24hr formats)
- Waits and retries automatically when limits reset
- Uses native --resume for session-aware continuation (Claude Code v2.0+)
- Queues multiple tasks with deterministic priority ordering
- Persists state with crash recovery (atomic writes, flock-based locking)
- Sends notifications when work completes (terminal bell, webhook, desktop)

## Install
go install github.com/hseinmoussa/claude-autopilot@latest

## Quick usage
claude-autopilot add "Implement auth module" --dir . --priority 1
claude-autopilot run --yes
claude-autopilot status

## Key commands
- add: queue a new task
- run: execute all tasks with auto-retry
- list: show tasks in execution order
- status: show runner state and next resume time
- retry: re-queue a failed task
- cancel: cancel a pending task
- config: manage settings (webhook_url, hang_timeout, etc.)

## Language
Go (single binary, zero runtime dependencies)
